intro: Bulbostylis burkei, commonly known as the Cape York sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to northern Australia, particularly found in the Cape York Peninsula region. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in areas with consistently moist soil. Bulbostylis burkei plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
